DOCNAME: CASE OF WOJCIECH NOWAK v. POLAND

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant married ORG In DATE they had a son , D. Subsequently , the applicant and ORG separated . Since their separation , they have been living in the same town and in the same street .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an interim contact order . According to its terms , the applicant was allowed to visit the child every DATE and every first DATE and third DATE , QUANTITY

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the GPE police intervened on CARDINAL occasions in order to facilitate the applicant 's contact with his child . These interventions took place at ORG 's place of residence and it would appear that on all these occasions the applicant was able to see the child .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dissolved the applicant 's marriage . It awarded parental rights to ORG , limited the applicant in the exercise of his rights and ordered that NORP 's permanent residence be with his mother . The applicant was allowed to participate in decisions about the child 's education and health .
CARDINAL . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant made applications for fines to be imposed on ORG under LAW . He subsequently withdrew the applications .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG modified the access arrangements to allow the applicant to take his son for DATE holiday CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the GPE police intervened on QUANTITY occasions in order to facilitate the applicant 's contact with NORP It appears that only on one of these occasions was the applicant unable to see NORP , as the child stated that he had not wished to see his father .
CARDINAL . On DATE , on the applicant 's motion , ORG ordered ORG to allow the applicant 's contact with the child on pain of a CARDINAL ORG fine .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the police intervened on CARDINAL occasions in order to enforce the applicant 's contacts with his son .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and his ex - wife concluded a court settlement concerning the applicant 's visiting right . According to its terms the contacts were to be enforced under supervision of a court appointed guardian in order to protect NORP 's well - being .

CARDINAL . NORP However , the mother failed to comply with the access arrangements . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to impose a fine on ORG for failure to comply with the settlement . On DATE ORG ordered ORG to make the child available for a visit ( by DATE ) , on pain of having to pay a fine .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged yet another request for a fine to be imposed on ORG On DATE ORG dismissed that request . The court obtained reports from CARDINAL experts including a psychologist and heard evidence from several witnesses . It considered that ORG had not turned the child against his father . It noted that the child had not wished to attend the meetings with his father . Moreover , because of the forced contacts , in particular the DATE holiday in DATE , NORP started suffering from anxiety and fear . The court also made reference to the fact that the applicant had proposed not to have any contacts with the child for DATE if ORG did not claim maintenance payments for that period . The applicant 's further appeal was dismissed by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the applicant filed a motion for amendment of the divorce decree in the part relating to parental rights . On DATE ORG dismissed his application .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed , and on DATE ORG gave a decision granting custody to the applicant and ordering that NORP 's permanent residence be with his father . The mother was allowed to participate in decisions concerning the child 's education and choice of profession .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed an application with ORG to be granted sole custody of NORP
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the applicant 's request to impose a fine on ORG since he had failed to pay the required court fee . His subsequent interlocutory appeal was dismissed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG modified the decision of DATE . The court held that ORG should be granted full custody over NORP and that NORP 's place of residence should be with his mother . The applicant was allowed to decide jointly about the child 's education and choice of profession .

CARDINAL . A further appeal lodged by the applicant was dismissed by ORG on DATE . The court held that the applicant had not had a good relationship with his child and that the boy was afraid of him . The court stressed that the applicant could not have successfully claimed custody over NORP since his son fled from him whenever he had seen him .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , the applicant asked the court to hand NORP over to him . On DATE ORG gave an interim decision and held that while the custody proceedings were pending the child should stay with his mother . On DATE ORG refused to hand NORP over to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's motion to impose a fine on ORG for obstructing his access to the child .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again requested that NORP be restored to him . On DATE ORG refused his request . The applicant did not appeal against that decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an application to be granted full parental rights . His application was dismissed by ORG on DATE . The court held that NORP had been living with his mother , with whom he had very close relations , and it was in the child 's best interest to leave him with her . The court referred to the child 's ( then DATE ) own statements that his mother had not obstructed his contact with the applicant . It was NORP himself who had avoided contact with his father . The court further noted that DATE ( when ORG filed a claim for increase of maintenance payments ) the applicant had not attempted to contact his son and to exercise his visiting rights . Their contact was limited to occasional meetings on the street , since they lived nearby . The applicant 's appeal against this decision was dismissed on DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked the court to impose a fine on the mother for obstructing his contacts with NORP On DATE ORG dismissed his request . The applicant did not appeal against that decision .
